name: Jitsi Meet
description: Secure video conferencing and desktop sharing using WebRTC.

name: ProtonMail
description: Free encrypted email.

name: Ring
description: Telephone, teleconferencing, and media sharing through a distributed service.

name: Signal
description: Private messaging and calling for desktop, Android, and iOS.

name: Telegram
description: Cloud-based mobile and desktop messaging app with a focus on security and speed.

name: Tox
description: Encrypted and distributed messaging platform with voice, video, and screen sharing.

name: Wire
description: Text, audio, and video communication with end-to-end encryption.

name: Dropfile.to
description: Anonymous file upload site that does not store user information.

name: Mega
description: 50 GB of secure free storage. Files are encrypted client-side.

name: qBittorrent
description: Free and open source BitTorrent client.

name: Amaze File Manager
description: Open source, Material Design file explorer for Android devices.

name: Ready
description: Minimalist news reader for iOS.

name: Libre.fm
description: Stream, download, remix, and share music for free.

name: mStream
description: Suite of software for syncing and streaming music across multiple devices.

name: Adbusters
description: Magazine about the takeover of psychological, physical, and cultural environments by commercial forces.

name: Aeon
description: Digital magazine that publishes original thinking on science, philosophy, society, and the arts.

name: Common Dreams
description: Progressive news website.

name: Consumerist
description: Independent source of consumer news and information.

name: Ello
description: Media platform for creators and artists that does not sell user data.

name: RealSport
description: Fans write articles on football, basketball, cricket, e-sports, motorsports, and most other sports out there. This site is committed to maintaining an experience free of pop-ups, fake news, click-bait, and ads.

name: The Conversation
description: High quality, authenticated, explanatory journalism funded by universities.

name: OpenStreetMap
description: Map of the world created by users and released under an open license.

name: Wikipedia
description: Encyclopedia that anyone can edit.

name: Wiktionary
description: Dictionary that anyone can edit.

name: GNUsocial.no
description: Allows users to connect and share with each other; expenses are covered by donations.

name: Lobsters
description: Simple link aggregation site with explanations required to downvote.

name: Mastodon
description: Free, open source, and decentralized social network server.

name: Quitter.se
description: Twitter clone that is part of the federated GNU social network.

name: Etherpad
description: Collaborative document editing in real-time.

name: ProtectedText
description: Online encrypted notepad with storage and no sign up.

name: Taskade
description: Collaborative task lists and outlines.

name: Goblin Refuge
description: Video (and image!) sharing service powered by MediaGoblin.

name: Vimeo
description: Alternative to YouTube for viewing and uploading videos.

name: uBlock Origin
description: General-purpose blocker that removes ads and privacy-invading trackers by default.

name: A Call for Revolt: Advertising is the Anti-Minimalism
description: Opt-out of the advertising game.

name: Anti-Consumerism on Wikipedia
description: Overview of the sociopolitical ideology that opposes consumerism.

name: Conscious Success
description: Explores the idea of conscious success rather than accidental success, using ads as an example.

name: Criticism of Advertising on Wikipedia
description: Overview of common criticisms of advertising.

name: Saying Goodbye to $100K Per Year in Easy Income
description: Story of a blogger who chose a better way to make a living.

name: Vote With Your Wallet, Not Your Ad Blocker
description: Paying for ad-free services casts a bigger vote.

name: Ad Free Blog
description: Icons for showing opposition to the use of corporate advertising on blogs.

name: Anti-Advertising Agency
description: Project that calls into question the purpose and effects of advertising in public space.

name: No More Ads Manifesto
description: Manifesto promoting an Internet that is not a marketplace where users get targeted and profiled for marketing purposes.

name: Flattr
description: Browser add-on that distributes a monthly budget to websites you engage with the most.

name: Gratipay
description: Payment platform for open source projects that only charges processing fees, not its own fees.

name: Liberapay
description: Open source recurring donations platform.

name: OpenCollective
description: Enables groups to set up a collective, raise funds, and manage them transparently.

name: Patreon
description: Recurring funding for artists and creators on either a monthly basis or per creation.
